post: How do you create a lasting impact and action from a future generation of leaders? Bill of Rights Institute Vice President of Development Anthony Simone discusses how BRIs work in classrooms and communities teaches students to be responsible leaders. The Institute equips students with fundamental skills to become engaged citizens, valuable employees, and builders of their communities. Watch the video, "Creating Impact: What Happens When You Support BRI" now  https://lnkd.in/gME4_FqN. With the finest, free civics and history resources, educator professional development, and student programs promoting civic engagement and critical thinking, BRI equips the next generation with the skills they need to lead. Interested in supporting the Bill of Rights Institute? Visit  https://lnkd.in/g46izWV4 or contact Anthony Simone directly at asimone@mybri.org.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CreatingImpact

The Bill of Rights Institute is grateful for Presidents for Kids‘ generous donation to the Civics for Everyone initiative. Presidents For Kids is dedicated to making U. S. presidential history fun, accessible, and engaging for young learners. Through our magazine, we introduce kids to the leaders, events, and decisions that shaped America, helping them build a strong foundation in civics. By combining storytelling, activities, and trivia, we make history exciting while encouraging curiosity, critical thinking, and a deeper understanding of how government worksensuring civics is for everyone! Through the Civics for Everyone initiative, BRI is committed to the ongoing work of helping all students learn about our nations story, our government, and their rights and responsibilities as citizens. Learn more,  https://lnkd.in/eX8DHCFP.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicsforEveryone

Last month, the Bill of Rights Institute and Utah Valley Universitys Center for Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University partnered to host a civics workshop for educators at Southern Utah University. The full-day training introduced BRIs new elementary curriculum, BRI Jr., and provided strategies for teaching primary sources on the Articles of Confederation and the Bill of Rights. Teachers praised the session as one of the best theyve attended, noting the wealth of ready-to-use resources and classroom applications. Read more about the workshop on our blog, here  https://lnkd.in/eK8B34b3 Learn more about upcoming BRI events and professional development opportunities, visit  https://lnkd.in/eKkSxNzF.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI
